pros:
Work / life balance.
Help when needed.
People who will listen.
cons: None I can think of

pros: Great community environment. Beautiful campus
cons: Not forward thinking in terms of business and athletics

pros: Great people in all departments! Very close knit university.
cons: The pay is very minimal with maybe 2% raise each year, not based on merit.

pros: light work. Friendly employees. Nice Supervisor

pros: Laid back, they treat employees well

pros: Some good people and good benefits

pros:

Travel

job_title: Campus Police Officer in Greensburg, PA
pros: Family Environment, Courteous Staff and Students
cons: Not enough team building events for employees

job_title: Assistant Baseball Coach in Greensburg, PA
pros: There is a small, family-like atmosphere.
cons: Tuition cost & segregation between athletics & administration

job_title: Graduate Assistant of Student Involvement and Leadership Programs in Greensburg, PA
pros: Great school atmosphere; very welcoming!
cons: Always changing - both a good & bad thing

review_title: Good Place but lots of Issues
pros: friendly environment and education benefit for your family is great. Easy going environment, very giving if you need time off for your children's events.
cons: people have been in their positions forever, are usually set in their ways, other fellow employees are out for themselves to the point of back stabbing each other. Salaries are way below par with positions else where. Due to being short on staff employees usually wear 3-4 hats and take on multiple job responsibilities sometimes to the point of it would be at least 2 full time jobs somewhere else.

job_title: Center for Integrative Teaching Technician in Greensburg, PA
pros: A lot of the students are eager to experience the wonders of an Apple driven institution. Seminars for students and staff with a hands on learning environment. Super friendly people who are willing to offer help and guidance.
cons: Some aren't as willing to accept the technological advancements therefore limiting the full experience of the students.

pros: Great connection with the students. Provides the students and faculty with a lot of technological resources. Many really caring faculty to work with. Many opportunities to teach outside of your comfort zone.
cons: Faculty are asked to take on many responsibilities outside of teaching. Many programs are small, two faculty, so you have few people to bounce ideas off of within your discipline. Given conflicting goals in regards to working with students.

pros: Some technology is great. Pay is OK, benefits are good.
cons: Many employees have been there forever, and have never looked outside of the school to monitor current advances in their field. The university has grown exponentially in this time, and it is still managed like a tiny girl's school rather than the large, coeducational Catholic school it has become.

review_title: SHU as a university is great.  Depends on the individual departments as to how well the work environment is.
pros: Great people.  Beautiful campus and wonderful benefits.
cons: Budgets.  Pay.  Some people have been there too long.

pros:
Laid back work atmosphere
- Good work life balance
- Goals are not closely monitored
- Colleagues are fun and work hard
cons:
No room for advancement and managed poorly.
- Management does not take staff's ideas and recommendations into consideration.
- Disorganized and poor communication structure

pros:
From Administration to Support Staff, you will find wonderful people who make the work day enjoyable. 
Health Benefits are good. 
Vacation and Sick days are generous.
cons: Pay scale is not adequate. Cost of benefits is high, but the coverage is excellent.

pros: Innovative and leading the inititive on new technology
cons: Management has their own personal agendas

job_title: Assistant Football Coach in Greensburg, PA
pros: The Benefits for employees was great.
cons: The Lack of Support Staff: No Strength Coach, No Equipment Manager, No Secretary for 90 Players and 8 Coaches

pros: Gained a lot of experience.
cons: No benefits, housing, limited meal money
